component.name: RapidRAW
component.summary: A non-destructive, and GPU-accelerated RAW image editor built with performance in mind

description.p: RapidRAW is a modern, high-performance alternative to Adobe Lightroom®. It delivers a simple, beautiful editing experience in a lightweight package (under 20MB) for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

I developed this project as a personal challenge at the age of 18. My goal was to create a high-performance tool for my own photography workflow while deepening my understanding of both React and Rust, with the support from Google Gemini.

ul.li: Image Denoising: Implemented the BM3D algorithm for effective noise removal while preserving actual image detail.
White Balance Picker: Added a pipette tool to pick a neutral reference point and automatically set the correct temperature and tint.
Reworked Metadata Handling: Hovering over the file name now displays key shooting data. EXIF data is now reliably written to the file during export.
Reworked Grain: A new film grain engine that generates natural monochromatic noise without RGB color noise or grid patterns.
Delete Workflow Improvements: Deleting an image no longer forces the library list to reload, making culling significantly smoother.
Exposure slider added to masking tools.
Improved mask eraser tool behavior.
Batch export stability improvements and RAM optimization.
New export option added directly to the context menu.
Updated dark mode wallpaper.
Recursive Library View: You can now display an image grid that includes files from all subfolders within a selected directory.
Reworked HSL Luminance Controls: Reworked logic to prevent blocky artifacts on compressed images, resulting in smoother transitions.
Mask Stacking: Adding a new empty mask on top of another now adds to the stack without visually resetting the previous mask's changes.
Vibrancy Improvement: The algorithm has been tweaked to better protect skin tones from oversaturation.
Added support for the QOI file format.
Updated the rawloader library to support a wider range of cameras.
Improved handling of DNG files.
Fixed several bugs within the masking system.
Keyword Tagging: Tag images with custom keywords, AI suggestions, and quick shortcuts.
Virtual Copies: Create multiple edits of an image without duplicating the file on disk.
Folder Search: A new search bar to quickly find folders in the library panel.
"Open With" Support: Right-click an image in your file manager to open it directly in RapidRAW.
Improved AgX color matrices to fix the red-to-orange color shift.
Added new keyboard shortcuts for navigating the library.
The library now automatically scrolls to keep the selected image in view.
Added support for the EXR file format.
Redesigned the settings page for better usability.
The app is now locked to a single instance to prevent multiple windows.
Minor UI polish on some components and a new dark mode background.
The bottom bar now displays a count of how many images are selected.
AgX Color Management: Like in Blender and darktable, RapidRAW now supports the advanced AgX tone mapper for better highlight rolloff and more natural colors.
Reworked Exposure Controls: The exposure slider has been split into two more powerful controls: Exposure (for true exposure compensation) and Brightness (for adjusting mid-tones).
Copy Paste Settings: Selectively copy and paste adjustments between images with new Merge and Replace modes to give you full control over how settings are applied.
Processing Engine Settings: A new section to manually select the processing backend for performance tuning. Includes a Linux GPU Compatibility Mode to resolve stability issues for some users.
Moved more core parts from 8-bit to 32-bit float for increased precision.
Improved accuracy of the Color Mixer, which may cause some HSL-related edits to appear slightly different.
Faster image loading times.
RAW highlight recovery is now adjustable via the new processing engine settings.
Pin Folders: Tired of constantly navigating between folders on different drives? Now you can right click any folder to pin it to a dedicated section in the sidebar for quick access.
Apply Presets To Masks: Apply any saved preset directly to a mask. This is a huge time saver for applying targeted adjustments like a "Clarity Boost" to a subject mask.
Centré Adjustment: A new slider that acts like an inverted vignette, subtly boosting clarity, brightness, and contrast in the middle of the frame to draw attention to your subject.

Whole Image Mask Type: Added a new mask type that covers the entire image, useful as a base for subtracting or inverting other mask components. This also lays the groundwork for future mask types without cluttering the UI.
Library thumbnail updating is now much smoother.
Rawler is now a submodule, thanks to @william-sy.
The logger has been improved to output the full traceback for better debugging.
Completely reworked Exposure and Highlights sliders for more natural, realistic image adjustments.
Exposure adjustments now feature smoother rolloff and prevent oversaturation.
Highlights recovery produces significantly better detail and tonal balance.
Added a new Watermark feature in the export panel.
Users can add custom logos or branding to exported images.
Full control over position, anchor, scale, spacing, and opacity.
Various bug fixes and better crash handling.
Thumbnails in the filmstrip now update more smoothly.

description.p: Version 1.4.1 addresses critical performance issues introduced in v1.4.0, where using local contrast tools could cause severe slowdowns and even crashes.
I strongly recommend skipping v1.4.0 and upgrading directly to v1.4.1.
This update introduces several new tools and foundational improvements to the software.

ul.li: Auto Culling: Scans your selection for duplicates and blurry photos, then lets you flag or delete them in a batch to speed up your workflow.
Collage Maker: An integrated collage maker with multiple layouts, allowing you to control spacing, border radius, and background color.
Color Calibration: A new panel to directly modify the hue and saturation of the primary RGB channels, enabling more significant and stylized color shifts.
Universal Preset Importer: Import presets from other common photo editors. While not a 1:1 conversion, it provides a solid starting point for your edits.
Adjustments Visibility: A new setting lets you hide advanced adjustments you don't use, allowing you to maintain a simpler interface.
Sort Library by EXIF Data: Organize your photo library by ISO, aperture, focal length, and other EXIF tags.

Reworked Local Contrast Tools: The local contrast tools (Sharpness, Clarity, Structure) have been re-engineered to provide higher quality results and interact more predictably with other adjustments like exposure.
Improved performance when loading library folders.
Various shader optimizations and bug fixes.
General improvements to application stability and logging.
Brand new app icons & dark theme wallpaper.

description.p: Important: Action Required for Upgrading Users

In this update, the application's internal identifier has been changed from com.rapidraw.app to io.github.CyberTimon.RapidRAW. This is a technical but important change that helps with long-term maintenance and ensures better compatibility going forward.
Unfortunately, this means that when you first launch v1.4.0, it won't be able to find your existing user data. As a result:

ul.li: Your AI models will need to be redownloaded.
Your library thumbnails will be regenerated.
Crucially, all of your saved presets will be gone.

description.p: To avoid losing your data, please choose one of the migration options below before you launch the new version for the first time.
This method migrates everything: your settings, presets, and cached data. To do this, you'll need to manually rename the application's data folder.

ul.li: Linux: The location can vary, but typically check ~/.config/ and ~/.local/share/. Rename the com.rapidraw.app folder in each relevant location to io.github.CyberTimon.RapidRAW.

description.p: If you only care about saving your presets and don't mind re-caching thumbnails and models, this is a simpler alternative.

ol.li: In your old version of RapidRAW, export all your presets to a safe location.
Import your presets using the new Universal Preset Importer.

description.p: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this one-time migration step causes. This change was a tough decision, but it sets the app up for a more stable and robust future. Thank you for your understanding!

I wanted to create a place where people can share presets with each other, so I've added a new Community Presets page. To get things started, I've already shared 7 of my own. I'm looking forward to seeing what you all come up with.
To submit your own preset, please follow the submission guide located at the bottom of the Community Presets page.

This release includes a new ComfyUI workflow that handles high-quality inpainting much better. The results should now be nearly the same resolution as the original image. The installation for the workflow is also simpler, now requiring only one custom ComfyUI node.

I've also adjusted the UI to better align with the project's AI Roadmap. This includes a placeholder for a planned future cloud service, which would be an option for those who don't have the hardware to self-host or prefer not to set it up themselves (not paywalling features).
If you have any ideas or feedback on the AI roadmap, feel free to let me know.
Upgrading to this version will reset the app’s settings & comfyui config (your edits will not be affected).
You can now toggle clipping warnings in the Curves tool to highlight overexposed areas in red and underexposed areas in blue.
With the new update notifier, you’ll never miss an update.

ul.li: Updated all dependencies and migrated from Rust 2021 to Rust 2024 (thanks @RayJW).
Improved performance through updated dependencies.
Enhanced accuracy in the HSL panel.
Fixed the inverted tint slider (you may need to readjust existing edits).

description.p: ComfyUI integration has been significantly improved to make it more accessible and user-friendly. You can now:

ul.li: Select a custom inpainting workflow or use the built-in default workflow.
Define and map which models should be loaded.
See which custom nodes you need to install, in order to use the default workflow.

description.p: RapidRAW automatically handles downscaling, mask generation, patch layer composition, and saving. These enhancements make ComfyUI integration practical for everyday use.

Note: Some bugs and unfinished elements may still be present. Please report any issues you encounter. Also, if you have a better & easier inpainting workflow, please share it with me as I'm not satisfied with the current one.
A new tool for chromatic aberration correction has been added.

ul.li: Changing folders now cancels previous thumbnail generation and folder indexing jobs, preventing performance slowdowns on many machines.
LUT's parser is more robust / less error prone now.
Mask grow / feather parameter now correctly applies on the final image.

description.ul:
LUTs You can now apply LUTs directly to your images, with support for .cube, .3dl, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, and .tiff files. This makes it easy to add color grading or use a LUT as a creative starting point.
Estimated File Size Before exporting, you’ll now see an estimated file size, helping you balance image quality with file size for the best results.
